physical_appearance: This is a batik kain panjang. It features two related designs on either side of the batik. The left side of the batik features bunches of calla lilies against a dense detailed white florals.  The right side features bunches of tulips against a similar background. There is a signature on the top-left of the batik.
sgcool_label_text: This kain panjang is structured in the pagi-sore format, comprising two different but related designs on each half of the kain panjang.  The main floral motif on one side consists of bunches of calla lilies against a minutely detailed background while tulips embellish the other side.  This batik comes from the family collection of Oey Djien Nio (1929-1987), the last in three generations of documented batik-makers in Pekalongan.  In her earlier signatures, she used her husband’s name, Liem Siok Hien.  But from 1965 onwards, she used Jane Hendromartono, combining her husband’s new Indonesian family name, Hendromartono with Jane, as people addressed her by.  She developed a personal style distinct from her mother and grandmother, and experimented with a wide spectrum of colours and exotic combinations of birds, rock formations and mythical animals.  Jane Hendromartono’s clientele expanded beyond the elite in Indonesia to include Europe, America and Japan, especially in the 1980s.  This piece is signed “Kesenia Indonesia 100% Tulis Hendromartono”.
